pr_title: Changing GGC to use Iot pre-prod if configured to do so

timeline.message: Changing GGC to use Iot pre-prod if configured to do so

timeline.bodyText: now that the endpoints are combined we should be able to remove this "FCS_ENDPOINT" and instead get the endpoint when we create the client, based on region and stage
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: We should update the endpoint that we use and make it configurable.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I thought this is the updated endpoint, took it from the document which Paul shared. Configurable from where?
replies.author: abanthiy

replies.bodyText:
I mean to update this one: https://github.com/aws/aws-greengrass-kernel/blob/5733d3c514f677ecf50bc7e00ba828368a7d22bc/src/main/java/com/aws/iot/evergreen/easysetup/DeviceProvisioningHelper.java#L72
And make that configurable through the DeviceConfiguration so that we can override it in the config.yaml during UATs. We definitely need this once the default is prod, but we still need to test in gamma.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: print the exception to stderr/stdout as well or rethrow. Otherwise it won't be clear because the logger will be going to files, but this should be user-facing.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: These 2 FCS and GCS clients can be the same now that we have a shared endpoint.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: this can be removed, just get the gcs client
timeline.author: MikeDombo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -340,7 +357,8 @@ private static void cleanUpTestComponentArtifactsFromS3() {
     private static synchronized AWSEvergreen getFcsClient() {

timeline.bodyText: default should be east-1 because that's all that evergreen is deployed to
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: If the --region isn't specified, we should fallback to DeviceConfiguration.getRegion(). And if it is specified, then we should update the region in the DeviceConfiguration
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.message: Changing GGC to use Iot pre-prod if configured to do so
Changing GGC to use Iot pre-prod if configured to do so

timeline.bodyText: does cloud prod actually work? We've only ever tested against gamma. Just wondering if the default should be gamma.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: It will eventually need to be prod, for all our testing we are configuring it so this should be fine
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: use kernel.getContext().get(DeviceConfiguration.class) (this may be problematic to call in the constructor though)? We should be using the same device configuration object everywhere
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I think context will have the object when launch happens, but this (including parseArgs) will be hit before kernel launch.
replies.author: abanthiy

replies.bodyText: Context is created in the Kernel constructor.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: you don't need to nullcheck. It is never allowed to be null
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: This code should not rely on that.
replies.author: abanthiy

replies.bodyText: You're getting the Topic, not the value and that topic is guaranteed to not be null. This is part of the interface of the DeviceConfiguration.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: Do we have these 2 new throws?
timeline.author: hui-yang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -136,12 +148,13 @@
      * @param outStream writer to use to send text response to user
      * @param errStream writer to use to send error response to user
      * @param setupArgs CLI args for setup script
+     * @throws URISyntaxException when IotEndpoint is malformed
+     * @throws InvalidEnvironmentStageException when the environment stage configured is invalid

replies.bodyText:
Also do we need to update the other constructor below?
EvergreenSetup(PrintStream outStream, PrintStream errStream, DeviceProvisioningHelper deviceProvisioningHelper, String... setupArgs)

timeline.bodyText:
[No need to change]
why?
To keep device/cloud consistency, I can add this into the common serializer instead of just device side.
timeline.author: leaf94

replies.bodyText:
Caused by: com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.UnrecognizedPropertyException: Unrecognized field "componentDependencies" (class com.amazon.aws.iot.greengrass.component.common.ComponentRecipe$ComponentRecipeBuilder), not marked as ignorable (8 known properties: "recipeFormatVersion", "manifests", "componentType", "componentName", "componentVersion", "componentDescription", "componentSource", "componentPublisher"])

Is why. Cloud broke us.
